Let $\alpha$ be the infinite ordinal $\omega^{\omega^2}$. Is it true that in any red/blue colouring of the edges of $K_\alpha$ there is either a red $K_\alpha$ or a blue $K_3$?



For comparison, Specker \cite{Sp57} proved this property holds when $\alpha=\omega^2$ and false when $\alpha=\omega^n$ for $3\leq n<\omega$. Chang proved this property holds when $\alpha=\omega^\omega$ (see [590]).

See [592] for the general case.




References


[Sp57] Specker, Ernst, Teilmengen von Mengen mit Relationen. Comment. Math. Helv. (1957), 302-314.
